titleStmt.title: Benjamin F. Graves et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9131

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky --

The undersigned petitioners represent That Martin Skaine was tried in the Lexington City Court for an assault upon Matthew McNamara -- and was fined $20. besides costs amounting to $17 -- There was no battery proved in the case -- McNamara had just before the said assault was committed, beat and shot a friend of the Defendant Skaine -- and it was this circumstance that led him to commit the assault -- He is a peaceable man and in very moderate circumstances -- and the costs amount to a sufficient punishment

Benj F Graves
T. L. Price
W Payne
James B Beck
M B Johnson
Chas B Thomas
James B Clay

Lexington City Ct
$20. } Assault
Martin Skain
Issd July 22d 1862
